title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
description: The cold, wild land of Alaska is sometimes called "The Last Frontier." From the exciting history of gold miners to the bright future of the state's oil fields, Alaska is a unique part of the United States. It is the largest state in the union-covering over 1.7 million square kilometers-and is home to Mount McKinley, the tallest mountain in North America. People from all over the world come to see Alaska's beautiful landscapes and amazing wildlife.
highFrequencyWords: Arctic Circle, aurora borealis, delicacies, economy, individualism, kayaks, preserve, relatively, tundra
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
comprehension: Conjunctions                : Differentiate between coordinating and subordinating conjunctions
awareness: Abbreviations                : Identify and fluently read abbreviations
phonics:
Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
